post.description: Sign in with a social provider

callbackURL.description: Callback URL to redirect to after the user has signed in

errorCallbackURL.description: Callback URL to redirect to if an error happens

disableRedirect.description: Disable automatic redirection to the provider. Useful for handling the redirection yourself

nonce.description: Nonce used to generate the token

scopes.description: Array of scopes to request from the provider. This will override the default scopes passed.

requestSignUp.description: Explicitly request sign-up. Useful when disableImplicitSignUp is true for this provider

loginHint.description: The login hint to use for the authorization code request

200.description: Success - Returns either session details or redirect URL

schema.description: Session response when idToken is provided

401.description: Unauthorized. Due to missing or invalid authentication.

500.description: Internal Server Error. This is a problem with the server that you cannot fix.

post.description: Create a new API key for a user

userId.description: User Id of the user that the Api Key belongs to. server-only. Eg: "user-id"

refillAmount.description: Amount to refill the remaining count of the Api Key. server-only. Eg: 100

refillInterval.description: Interval to refill the Api Key in milliseconds. server-only. Eg: 1000

rateLimitTimeWindow.description: The duration in milliseconds where each request is counted. Once the `maxRequests` is reached, the request will be rejected until the `timeWindow` has passed, at which point the `timeWindow` will be reset. server-only. Eg: 1000

rateLimitMax.description: Maximum amount of requests allowed within a window. Once the `maxRequests` is reached, the request will be rejected until the `timeWindow` has passed, at which point the `timeWindow` will be reset. server-only. Eg: 100

rateLimitEnabled.description: Whether the key has rate limiting enabled. server-only. Eg: true

id.description: Unique identifier of the API key

start.description: Starting characters of the key (if configured)

key.description: The full API key (only returned on creation)

userId.description: ID of the user owning the key

rateLimitTimeWindow.description: Rate limit time window in milliseconds

get.description: Retrieve an existing API key by ID

schema.description: The id of the Api Key

start.description: Shows the first few characters of the API key, including the prefix. This allows you to show those few characters in the UI to make it easier for users to identify the API key.

prefix.description: The API Key prefix. Stored as plain text.

userId.description: The owner of the user id

refillInterval.description: The interval in milliseconds between refills of the `remaining` count. Example: 3600000 // refill every hour (3600000ms = 1h)

enabled.description: Sets if key is enabled or disabled

rateLimitEnabled.description: Whether the key has rate limiting enabled

rateLimitMax.description: Maximum amount of requests allowed within a window

requestCount.description: The number of requests made within the rate limit time window

remaining.description: Remaining requests (every time api key is used this should updated and should be updated on refill as well)

permissions.description: Permissions for the api key (stored as JSON string)

post.description: Create a new team within an organization

name.description: The name of the team. Eg: "my-team"

organizationId.description: The organization ID which the team will be created in. Defaults to the active organization. Eg: "organization-id"

id.description: Unique identifier of the created team

organizationId.description: ID of the organization the team belongs to

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the team was created

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the team was last updated

plan.description: The name of the plan to upgrade to. Eg: "pro"

annual.description: Whether to upgrade to an annual plan. Eg: true

referenceId.description: Reference ID for the subscription. Eg: "org_123"

subscriptionId.description: The Stripe subscription ID to upgrade. Eg: "sub_1ABC2DEF3GHI4JKL"

customerType.description: Customer type for the subscription. Eg: "user" or "organization"

seats.description: Number of seats to upgrade to (if applicable). Eg: 1

locale.description: The locale to display Checkout in. Eg: 'en', 'ko'. If not provided or set to `auto`, the browser's locale is used.

successUrl.description: Callback URL to redirect back after successful subscription. Eg: "https://example.com/success"

cancelUrl.description: If set, checkout shows a back button and customers will be directed here if they cancel payment. Eg: "https://example.com/pricing"

returnUrl.description: URL to take customers to when they click on the billing portal’s link to return to your website. Eg: "https://example.com/dashboard"

disableRedirect.description: Disable redirect after successful subscription. Eg: true
